result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin Aaron Black was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Full Transcript in 15CM1253.  Plea and Sentencing Hearing, October 30, 2015.

Defendant Justin Aaron Black in court with attorney Steven W. Zaleski.  Mary Elizabeth Bricco appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads no contest to count 1. Court finds defendant guilty of count 1. Court orders 60 days jail with huber, diversion program and concurrent with 15CM1757,  restitution, costs DOC collect.
Defendant Justin Aaron Black in court with attorney Steven W. Zaleski.  Anne Theresa Nack appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status conference scheduled for October 30, 2015 at 09:00 am.
